RunObject.title: A run on a thread
RunObject.description: Represents an execution run on a [thread](/docs/api-reference/threads).

id.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

object.description: The object type, which is always `thread.run`.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run was created.

thread_id.description: The ID of the [thread](/docs/api-reference/threads) that was executed on as a part of this run.

assistant_id.description: The ID of the [assistant](/docs/api-reference/assistants) used for execution of this run.

status.description: The status of the run, which can be either `queued`, `in_progress`, `requires_action`, `cancelling`, `cancelled`, `failed`, `completed`, or `expired`.

required_action.description: Details on the action required to continue the run. Will be `null` if no action is required.

type.description: For now, this is always `submit_tool_outputs`.

submit_tool_outputs.description: Details on the tool outputs needed for this run to continue.

tool_calls.description: A list of the relevant tool calls.

items.description: Tool call objects

id.description: The ID of the tool call. This ID must be referenced when you submit the tool outputs in using the [Submit tool outputs to run](/docs/api-reference/runs/submitToolOutputs) endpoint.

type.description: The type of tool call the output is required for. For now, this is always `function`.

name.description: The name of the function.

arguments.description: The arguments that the model expects you to pass to the function.

last_error.description: The last error associated with this run. Will be `null` if there are no errors.

message.description: A human-readable description of the error.

expires_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run will expire.

started_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run was started.

cancelled_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run was cancelled.

failed_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run failed.

completed_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run was completed.

model.description: The model that the [assistant](/docs/api-reference/assistants) used for this run.

instructions.description: The instructions that the [assistant](/docs/api-reference/assistants) used for this run.

tools.description: The list of tools that the [assistant](/docs/api-reference/assistants) used for this run.

tools.description: The list of tools that the [assistant](/docs/api-reference/assistants) used for this run.

The type of tool being defined: `function`

description.description: A description of what the function does, used by the model to choose when and how to call the function.

name.description: The name of the function to be called. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

parameters.description:
The parameters the functions accepts, described as a JSON Schema object. See the [guide](/docs/guides/text-generation/function-calling) for examples, and the [JSON Schema reference](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/) for documentation about the format.

To describe a function that accepts no parameters, provide the value `{"type": "object", "properties": {}}`.

RunStepObject.title: Run steps
RunStepObject.description: Represents a step in execution of a run.

id.description: The identifier of the run step, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

object.description: The object type, which is always `thread.run.step``.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run step was created.

assistant_id.description: The ID of the [assistant](/docs/api-reference/assistants) associated with the run step.

thread_id.description: The ID of the [thread](/docs/api-reference/threads) that was run.

run_id.description: The ID of the [run](/docs/api-reference/runs) that this run step is a part of.

type.description: The type of run step, which can be either `message_creation` or `tool_calls`.

status.description: The status of the run step, which can be either `in_progress`, `cancelled`, `failed`, `completed`, or `expired`.

step_details.description: The details of the run step.

oneOf.title: Message creation
oneOf.description: Details of the message creation by the run step.

type.description: Always `message_creation``.

message_id.description: The ID of the message that was created by this run step.

oneOf.title: Tool calls
oneOf.description: Details of the tool call.

type.description: Always `tool_calls`.

tool_calls.description: An array of tool calls the run step was involved in. These can be associated with one of three types of tools: `code_interpreter`, `retrieval`, or `function`.

oneOf.title: Code interpreter tool call
oneOf.description: Details of the Code Interpreter tool call the run step was involved in.

id.description: The ID of the tool call.

type.description: The type of tool call. This is always going to be `code_interpreter` for this type of tool call.

code_interpreter.description: The Code Interpreter tool call definition.

input.description: The input to the Code Interpreter tool call.

outputs.description: The outputs from the Code Interpreter tool call. Code Interpreter can output one or more items, including text (`logs`) or images (`image`). Each of these are represented by a different object type.

oneOf.title: Code interpreter log output
oneOf.description: Text output from the Code Interpreter tool call as part of a run step.

type.description: Always `logs`.

logs.description: The text output from the Code Interpreter tool call.

type.description: Always `image`.

id.description: The ID of the tool call object.

type.description: The type of tool call. This is always going to be `retrieval` for this type of tool call.

retrieval.description: For now, this is always going to be an empty object.

id.description: The ID of the tool call object.

type.description: The type of tool call. This is always going to be `function` for this type of tool call.

function.description: The definition of the function that was called.

name.description: The name of the function.

arguments.description: The arguments passed to the function.

output.description: The output of the function. This will be `null` if the outputs have not been [submitted](/docs/api-reference/runs/submitToolOutputs) yet.

last_error.description: The last error associated with this run step. Will be `null` if there are no errors.

message.description: A human-readable description of the error.

expired_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run step expired. A step is considered expired if the parent run is expired.

cancelled_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run step was cancelled.

failed_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run step failed.

completed_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the run step completed.

metadata.description: Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format. Keys can be a maximum of 64 characters long and values can be a maxium of 512 characters long.

groups.title: Audio
groups.description:
Learn how to turn audio into text or text into audio.

Related guide: [Speech to text](/docs/guides/speech-to-text)

groups.title: Chat
groups.description:
Given a list of messages comprising a conversation, the model will return a response.

Related guide: [Chat Completions](/docs/guides/text-generation)

groups.title: Embeddings
groups.description:
Get a vector representation of a given input that can be easily consumed by machine learning models and algorithms.

Related guide: [Embeddings](/docs/guides/embeddings)

groups.title: Fine-tuning
groups.description:
Manage fine-tuning jobs to tailor a model to your specific training data.

Related guide: [Fine-tune models](/docs/guides/fine-tuning)

groups.title: Files
groups.description: Files are used to upload documents that can be used with features like [Assistants](/docs/api-reference/assistants) and [Fine-tuning](/docs/api-reference/fine-tuning).

groups.title: Images
groups.description:
Given a prompt and/or an input image, the model will generate a new image.

Related guide: [Image generation](/docs/guides/images)

groups.title: Models
groups.description: List and describe the various models available in the API. You can refer to the [Models](/docs/models) documentation to understand what models are available and the differences between them.

groups.title: Moderations
groups.description:
Given a input text, outputs if the model classifies it as violating OpenAI's content policy.

Related guide: [Moderations](/docs/guides/moderation)

groups.title: Assistants
groups.description:
Build assistants that can call models and use tools to perform tasks.

[Get started with the Assistants API](/docs/assistants)

groups.title: Threads
groups.description:
Create threads that assistants can interact with.

Related guide: [Assistants](/docs/assistants/overview)

groups.title: Messages
groups.description:
Create messages within threads

Related guide: [Assistants](/docs/assistants/overview)

groups.title: Runs
groups.description:
Represents an execution run on a thread.

Related guide: [Assistants](/docs/assistants/overview)

groups.title: Completions
groups.description: Given a prompt, the model will return one or more predicted completions along with the probabilities of alternative tokens at each position. Most developer should use our [Chat Completions API](/docs/guides/text-generation/text-generation-models) to leverage our best and newest models. Most models that support the legacy Completions endpoint [will be shut off on January 4th, 2024](/docs/deprecations/2023-07-06-gpt-and-embeddings).

groups.title: Edits
groups.description: Given a prompt and an instruction, the model will return an edited version of the prompt. The Edits endpoint is deprecated will be [shut off on January 4th, 2024](/docs/deprecations/edit-models-endpoint).

groups.title: Fine-tunes
groups.description:
Manage fine-tuning jobs to tailor a model to your specific training data. The [updated Fine-tuning endpoint](/docs/guides/fine-tuning) offers more capabilites and newer models.

The Fine-tunes endpoint will be [shut off on January 4th, 2024](/docs/deprecations/2023-08-22-fine-tunes-endpoint).

apiKey.title: API Key
apiKey.description: Log into your OpenAI account and find your API key.
